intro: Ceropegia farrokhii, commonly known as the Farrokhii string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract specific pollinators. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets.
